doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 13 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 3/20/1987]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 13 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 3/20/1987]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, and Jim Levin, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund2. Short news stories3. Discussion of the increasing activism within the gay community, ties to "civil disobedience," and how to encourage new faces to join the protestCOMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund4. New York Times reports that Southern voters are extremely concerned with AIDS as a priority issue, discussion of how the AIDS issue will be used by politicians in the 1988 electionCOMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation, with Jose Sarria5. Andy Humm on the AIDS education of teenagers6. News Watch, new study shows that the longer a person is infected with HIV, the greater their chance is of developing AIDS7. Madison Avenue advertising firm denounce remark by Lifestyles Condoms, who stated "AIDS is a condom-marketers dream"8. AZT renamed to Retrovir, to limit confusion in foreign countries where AZT is the name of an immuno-suppressant9. Sacramento Union publishes profile of gay male couple for Valentine series, and receives complaints10. Sports Report11. Lavender Health, interview with Liz [Walker], head of Domestic Violence Services at NYC Gay and Lesbian Anti-Violence Project12. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. This Week in Gay History, with Jeff BixbyCOMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball2. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of Barbara Lea's cabaret show, "The Melody Lingers On"COMMERCIAL: Zamir Furs3. Naming Names segment, exposing persons in the media who misrepresent gay and lesbian people, sponsored by GLAAD: John Cardinal O'ConnorCOMMERCIAL: "Suds" gay soap opera, created by GCN4. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, interview with Stephen McCauley, author of "Object of My Affection"COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball5. Third part of the interview series on the operating methods of GMHC, with playwright Larry Kramer, and a response by the executive director of GMHC, Richard Dunne, tape cuts off
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 13 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 3/20/1987]: March 1987
